Comment: Opening up the queen and f1 bishop and controlling d5.
A common response, the king pawn game.
Attacking the pawn and leading to several common openings.
Protecting the pawn.  Other moves are d6 (Philidor) or Nf6 (Petrov).
The Scotch Opening.  Planning dxe5, winning a pawn.
Destroying the threat and the d4 pawn.
Recapturing and putting a knight in the center of the board.
Not the best move.  This allows the white queen to come to a powerful post at d4.  Better is Bc5 or Nf6.
Black is hoping for Qxf6 Nxf6 or a retreat of the queen.
This is a good move that wins a tempo for white.
A move that tries to avoid giving up a tempo by threatening the c2 pawn.  If Qb6 Qxb6 and Nc3 or Qc6 Nc3 or Qe6 Bc4.
Developing with tempo.  The pawn is not as undefended as it seems.
